main event: An unidentified flying object was observed visually by airmen stationed at Harmon Air Force Base, Newfoundland, on 6 May 1954.
interesting points: The object was watched for a period of 12 to 15 minutes., The object appeared to be surrounded by a luminous glow and was observed to change direction and altitude during the sighting., Radar contact was maintained with the object intermittently throughout the sighting., The object was estimated to be traveling at a speed of 600 to 800 knots at an altitude of approximately 30,000 feet., It is considered that the object was real and material and not an atmospheric or astronomical phenomenon.
witness description: airmen stationed at Harmon Air Force Base
